page.title: 08OVER WYRESDALE: FARM WORK
page.content: While most of the work on the farms is done by the owners or tenants and their families some of the major tasks are contracted out, often to men from the local area. The cost of machinery required for such tasks as making silage may be too high for individual farmers,and contractors also bring men with them so that the work is finished more rapidly. Owing to the very wet summer in 1985 'big bale' silage,which is stored in large black plastic bags, has been made here for the first time. Sheep shearing is rarely done by the farmer himself, nor is hedging. The farmer at Swainshead Hall rears horses in addition to sheep on land in the south of the area. This man is the only one here to grow any cereals, but merely a small quantity of barley. There are also some field trials of potatoes on this farm.
